title: What was the first audio visual recording? - Quora

response.answer_text: The first audio visual recording was the Dickson Experimental Sound Film of 1895. The Dickson Experimental Sound Film - Wikipedia The Dickson Experimental Sound Film is a film made by William Dickson in late 1894 or early 1895. It is the first known film with live-recorded sound and appears to be the first motion picture made for the Kinetophone, the proto-sound-film system developed by Dickson and Thomas Edison. Dickson also stars in the film, as the violinist!  It was recorded at Edison’s first studio, that could be pivoted to follow the sun.Edison's Black Maria - Wikipedia    Google Maps Edit: “Only forty-five Kinetophone machines were sold”[1] They claimed an earlier sound movie in 1889:[2] [3] [4] [5][6] “By Dickson’s own account, he produced a more-or-less successful synchronized sound film circa October 1889, combining phonographic sound and kinetoscopic visuals. Upon Edison’s return from the Paris Expedition of 1889, a brief welcome-home film was presented to him in which, reportedly, Dickson “stepped out on the screen, raised his hat and smiled, while uttering the words of greeting, ‘Good morning, Mr. Edison, glad to see you back. I hope you are satisfied with the kineto-phonograph.” Alas, no physical trace of this very earliest of sound films is known to survive, although other (silent) test films from 1889 do. Because of this, some have questioned whether the 1889 “welcome home” sound film was ever actually made or if it is simply yet another example of early cinema braggadocio.”The Pre-History of Sound Cinema: Thomas Edison and WKL Dickson Possibly Dickson was lip-syncing live to the moving image, rather than a recorded voice?
